title: Breakthrough Alzheimer's Treatment Shows 70% Cognitive Improvement in Trials
introText: A revolutionary Alzheimer's treatment has shown unprecedented results in Phase 3 clinical trials, with patients demonstrating 70% improvement in cognitive function. The FDA is fast-tracking approval, offering hope to millions of families.

content.content: Phase 3 trials involving 3,000 patients showed 70% improvement in cognitive assessments and 60% reduction in disease progression. Some early-stage patients returned to near-normal function.
The treatment combines amyloid-clearing antibodies with a novel approach targeting tau proteins. The dual mechanism addresses both hallmarks of Alzheimer's disease.
The FDA has granted breakthrough therapy designation, expediting review. Approval could come by mid-2026. If approved, 6 million Americans with Alzheimer's could benefit.
